ka0-DzE8SHuC0sH9Z3Eu5Q.text: I tend to get a buritto from here rather than Chilango's as the value for money is better. In terms of quality its ok, but if we are being honest it isn't the best in Islington, let alone London. I only come here as I'm fed up of paying Chilango's inflated prices.

xZwlr7GIjl9Erm3rAtrjLQ.text: Almost a real US-style burrito and frozen margarita! (I'm from Texas and California, so can claim some knowledge) Definitely the best I've had in London. This is the fast-food folks in the south-western US have come to love. Luckily, it seems a lot healthier than a kebab or chicken and chips. If you're not familar with Mexican food: this is just like a cafe, where they assemble a sandwich in front of you, as you choose your ingredients. Typically a burrito has: (CA-style) rice, beans, meat, salsa with optional cheese, sour cream, guac. (TX-style) meat, salsa, cheese, sour cream, guac with optional beans & rice. They've got several choices for rice, beans, meat, & salsa. They wrap the burrito in tinfoil to keep it all together while you eat it with your hands. You slowly unwrap a little bit at a time as you nosh your way town the yummy tube of goodness. The medium costs 4.5 quid and will fill you right up. Now you don't have to get a burrito if you're looking for a lighter meal. Instead you can get the burrito in a bowl, or burrito fixings atop a salad, or soft tacos. It's all the same ingredients arranged in different ways. That's the beauty of California fast-food Mexican dining. There are a few large tables available for stopping at and eating. You'd be surprised just how quickly you can finish a burrito. They have a good selection of Mexican beers (Dos Equis, Pacifco, Negro Modelo) and the Texan favorite, frozen lime margaritas. You have to pay extra for tortilla chips, which is unusual, but typical of Chipotle the US chain that this shop seems based upon. I didn't try them this time, since I wanted to actually finish my burrito, something I never accomplish in California. This restaurant is great if: you're really hungry and you want to eat now, you're looking for healthy/different fastfood options, you're hankering for Mexican food, or you don't have a lot of money. At 9pm on a Tuesday it seemed to be quite popular with the post-gym ladies and gentlemen.

6hJs35IYoJuRfeucSxAObg.text: Large portions, plenty of choices and delicious food. Far superior to Chilango in my opinion and cheaper too!

381g4j_xGyH5oo1MSaCEjA.text: Must update- tried the burrito with steak today instead of chicken and it was SO good. I highly recommend paying the extra 50p for steak!

84cO5gFm1qu6r4dcDbuuRg.text: I'm with mdaniel74 on this one... Burritos were plain compared to other alternatives locally. I'm a big burrito fan and expected better from the decent reviews. They need to learn to wrap them so they stay together properly. I think there is only one (or maybe two) in London the service is impersonal and feels like as if it were a big chain.

Ae9uIwmZC6Z1VbYnJodfeg.text: Perhaps I was a little biased by the circumstances (not having had a burrito for over a month), but my chicken burrito with black beans, sour cream, cheddar, salsa fresca, salsa verde, doused in about 1/4 cup of Cholula hit the spot. I think the overall quality of the burrito was similar to that of Chipotle but perhaps just a little better. It might have been the tortilla or salsa. The size of the burrito was definitely smaller, but come on, does anyone actually need that last 1/4th of a Chipotle burrito. For London, I'll take it.

k2Eg7jT_wybW6KM8wi27qg.text: The english equivalent of Chipoltle.Went here with friends yesterday for lunch.  While I had just eaten about an hour ago, and had only gone to hang out I couldn't resist trying the fresh Mexican food which was impossible to find in London-until now.  With fresh steak burritos, salsa, and tortilla chips, a trip to Tortilla gave me exactly what I had been missing from home.  I will also note that this place is extremely clean for a fast food type of restaurant.  I will definitely be making quite a few trips back here.

cFbeFVvDWcsTdhNDhaUXcA.text: I've tried the naked burrito (burrito without the wrap) here twice. I'm not sure why but I expected better. The carnita naked burrito I had yesterday was rather bland, to be honest, and when I added hot sauce, the sauce was more salty than spicy. I'm pretty sure I've had better in London, though nothing springs to mind somehow. Maybe Luardo's? Service is average at best. My server yesterday had a rather strong accent and didn't speak all that loudly, so I couldn't understand anything she was saying, and had to ask her to repeat herself a number of times. She seemed to get irritated by that, and, in all honesty, I don't usually have a problem with most accents, so I'm just sayin' I don't think the problem lay entirely with me. I do like that drinks are refillable, but the coke was very heavily watered down!

RMsBYO8Cx43E4xQkB2dmuQ.text: Good place to come when you crave a burrito. Not so good if you want tasty food. Bland is the word. Steak in the burrito is chewy and lacks seasoning. Guacamole doesnt pack any heat. No complimentary chips. Not to be compared with San Fran Taquerias.

RMUyQx3XY2FVu2QqQILQ8g.text: This place is consistently delicious.  I always prefer it to fish & chips or any of the sandwich places when I need a quick lunch -- or even a quick dinner (and it is sometimes worth the trip to Angel just to have a good cheap dinner).  If you're a homesick Angelino, this is the best place in town.  Cholula hot sauce!!!!

3Jq_No9SvBPKnqCmSQC_PA.text: The last thing I want to eat when I'm abroad is Mexican food. That particular morning though, we were low on cash, we had already hit up the Angel a few times during the week, Burger King was not even an option, and we had a bit of a hangover and couldn't walk very far without keeling over.... so we hit up Tortilla. Not bad for London. The burritos are huge, and they pack them with plenty of "steak." All you can drink refills on soda??? Unheard of in London! So that was a plus for me. Would definitely hit it up again... if in desperate need of Mexican food while abroad.

LQ2LhbJnXhv_L2YC4UeSUw.text: I hear its good during the day but at night it was a bit mushy and just okay.

JfdIzUrSzEN-lTxKMUfc3w.text: I used to live in Los Angeles and I'd say their Burrito is close enough to the ones in LA.

F0Tv9tKcgh0Jii3BIPpkag.text: Really no different from the other burrito joints popping up around town. Saving grace is that they retail bottles of hot sauces, including sauces from Yucateco, Tapatio, cholula, and Dave's Gourmet (Insanity and Ultimate Insanity) among others.

jaL0JDsouH8cG8Dwk8TOlg.text: hungryinlondon.com/2011/…(for pictures and more) Recently I was invited to check out the Mexican fast food place Tortilla. Tortilla is a mini chain consisting of 5 branches in London and claims to serve healthy Mexican burritos. Tortilla clearly had no idea who they asked to scrutinize their restaurant as, to be honest, Mexican food is one of my least favourite cuisines. I really struggled when I was in Mexico to find anything I enjoyed eating. Having said this, I love Mexican ceviche, but in general there are just too many beans and cornmeal-based dishes and after a few days everything just started tasting the same. As far I have been successfully ignoring the current food trend of Mexican restaurants popping up all over London But of course I am willing to give everything a chance. I went to the Islington branch of Tortilla and my first impression was good. Wooden communal tables, clean layout, bright (maybe too bright) lighting, a nice mixture of people and big bottles of chili sauce on the table (have I mentioned that I am a chili addict?). You order your selection of burrito filling at the counter and your personalised burrito is prepared freshly. You have a choice of chicken, pork, beef or vegetarian, 2 different kinds of rice and 2 different kinds of beans. The burrito is finalised by putting on some chili sauce (mild/medium/spicy) and/or guacamole (+0.70) before being wrapped into a neat parcel. The damage for a medium sized tortilla (which is in fact huge!) is 4.95 and for a large one 5.95. Here it is, my nicely wrapped burrito to take away or eat in. My burrito contained grilled chicken, lime cilantro rice, black beans and hot salsa roja. To my big surprise I really liked it and even though I am not sure 'healthy' is the right word to describe it, it doesn't feel as if you were doing any major damage your body eating it. Tortilla hasn't quite changed my opinion about Mexican cuisine in general, but as far as fast food goes, it is a great option. I might even be back

IwEdObhLX_DFPYl5VxQJyA.text: £5 for a burrito the size of your head?  Yes, please.  The owners are from California and met with the owner of Chipotle before opening in London, so yes, the style is very similar.  Surprisingly they have really good frozen margaritas!  This place is the size of a shoe box with picnic table seating, so get cozy with the stranger next to you or get it for takeway.

I_92NhXwgrSPhhfvpgZz7w.text: This is the best taqueria I've found in London. Being from San Francisco, it's exciting to a find a restaurant that has a menu based on San Francisco style Mexican food. It's the first place I've found in London that knows how to season rice and wrap a burrito.  The hot sauce is not as spicy as you'd find in the mission, but tasty and if you ask them to drench your burrito in hot sauce it will almost be like being in California. I would recommend checking this place out.

a-Q2GAHRw3ZJnYXe4f6S-w.text: i've been away from home (san francisco, the mission) for just over 3 months and while i miss a lot of things (my friends, my own bed, my cat), i think the thing that could potentially make me break down and cry is if i think too much about burritos.  it wasn't until the pico hit my mouth that i allowed myself to think about the sweet warm rice, beans and meat of a mission burrito.  mmmm.tortilla makes excellent mission style burritos right in the middle of london.  thank god.  and thank also the piggie who gave for me his life to be carnitas.  bonus points for the mural on the wall that showed an artistic rendition of my 'hood including at least 4 of my favorite taquerias and a house that looks a lot like my old apartment building.

vOSDKVLsEPT3U_dM00Sl6g.text: Tortilla's burritos are as close to the real thing as I've found in London, after extensive and delicious research. Tortilla is doing a FANTASTIC job. I'm thrilled that burrito joints are catching on in London, but most could really benefit by taking their cue from Tortilla. The burrito ingredients here are tangy and fresh, with nicely steamed tortillas and warm innards melded together all the way through. The service is friendly and efficient.

GII4JpocFDSetAE26mWmoQ.text: I wasn't impressed with this place at all. I usually frequent another Mexican eaterie a little further up the road but I tried this for a change. As soon as I walked in I got the impression that the place was a little dirty. When I ordered my burrito the guy who served me wasn't particularly friendly or helpful and the whole process of ordering seemed cold and reminded me a little of getting school dinners. The food didn't taste particularly good either - for a start the burrito was filled too full so it unwrapped immediately and I had to eat it with a knife and fork, and the fillings just seemed very plain. I was impressed with the US style free drinks refills, but they didn't even try to hide the fact that their coke was heavily watered down. There are much better Mexican places in the area - I'd recommend giving this place a miss and walking a little further up the road.

O1B1Cpp8tAdxk058ib8qVg.text: Their burritos are an excellent hangover cure.

x2dgERjDz6pyLjmTG1x9xQ.text: Best American Style burrito in London. I have tried them all numerous times. Best Price, best choice of beans, rice ect Only place with cholula hot sauce on the tables people Seem to favor chillango which I do like... but I think they are just swayed by the decor of the place. if you like proper American style burritos try tortilla. Get the Pork

CJVJ77vBp7LRUTu4i6fyRg.text: I'm from California.  So naturally, I craved burritos for the year I was in London. And by burritos I mean anything near legit, not Texas embassy (thats a whole other review).  So Tortilla opened it, and I tried it once, and probably have been back at least once a week for a quick dinner or drunken lunch snack.  Large chicken burrito with guac. I don't know why I always get the large, but it's phenomenal, and once again.. FOOD COMA after I'm done.  A medium should be enough for a woman like me. Also, the soda with crushed iced here is amazing. Or the magaritas! :) Oh Tortilla, what would we do without you??? (Not faint.. omg, I fainted here once, it was so random and I'm pretty sure NOT food related. I think I was dehydrated from the pub.)

ItWSehiRedrd_KKpTTnbHA.text: this place makes a mean burrito! i've tried the steak and chicken ones....they fill it up good with cheese and stuff! i do like a good burito!

MHS2Nq9-IXukW3vvewLf_A.text: I work in the area, and there is not another place in london (i don't think) that you can get these massive and beautifully tasting burritos.  The deal is get there before 1 pm to avoid the queue, as it is everyone's lunch our and get a burrito, fajita wrap, taco, or salad (if you really want to be healthy).  Every time I go there I say to myself I will try the other choices but  can't! The burrito is too good!  Medium is still a good meal, the beans are not those sweet Heinz  (guacala!) from a can, they are true spanish beans, the guacamole not from a can, (you can really taste the difference, although extra 50p), and the grilled steak is juicy 'carne asada' again an extra 50p.  Ok, so after the extras it is a bit more than what you would want to pay (no extras £4.50) but you can treat yourself every once in a while, why not?  Looking for a low carb option, take the naked burrito, same as a traditional burrito but no tortilla.  Oh! they wrap those babies so well, nothing splurges out and the tortilla does not fall apart, you can go back to work as if nothing happened.  (My Ideal Burrito: spanish rice, black beans, grilled steak, cheese, lettuce, spicy pico de gallo, squirt of lime, take away please)

photos.caption: Photo of Tortilla - Islington - London, United Kingdom. tortilla in the rain

RlX2t0Oul0dclBE7sNRu5Q.text: Been here about 4 or 5 times and for how much they give you in a burrito, it's really worth it.  Reminds me of Chiptole joints back in California. Steak and chicken taste awesome! the Carnitas (pulled pork) is alright, bit salty.  The tortilla chips aren't very good though in my opinion.  Also wasn't very happy with getting only one stamp per day on the loyalty card when I helped buy burritos for a few friends totalling over £20. Overall for how filling the burrito is, I would be happy to swing by again if I'm around.

QtzbsrRGklGQ3Ux76Bcj3A.text: I'm a fan of this Tortilla branch. Given how hotly debated the merits of Mexican food (and by that I also mean Cali-Mex and all other derivatives) in London are, I wasn't really expecting to. It just happened to be on my route and I thought I'd give it a try after last year's Elite event at Tortilla's branch in Leadenhall Market.I opted for a regular chicken Fajita Wrap with Guacomole for £5.65. It was moist, nourishing and surprisingly tasty. So much so, that I rapidly found myself regretting not buying a large one. I had mine to go, but the seating looked reasonable and the staff were friendly and quick to serve.I will return.

hlMjl1IhMH9HEH2VemXF4Q.text: Handy spot for a burrito, freshly made, very like Chilango's. Sauces are noice. Can't say the spicy sauce is overly spicy but still tasty.I'm not an expert on Mexican food, but  it definitely tastes similar to what I have tasted in California and Mexico (Shock Horror!)  Although it is WAY better than Taco Bell....WAY better. That place is not good. At all.

Aw2AJKxW4tiHvUXo0W6Mew.text: So London doesn't know how to make a good burrito do they? Wrong! Tortilla step forward and take a bow. Taco Bell can kiss my ass, Tortilla is the real deal. Freshly wrapped burritos and fajitas in minutes. The choice is good too. Beef, pork, chicken or veggie. Different options on beans, rice and salad. £4.60 for a medium or £5.60 for a large... Yes please! I am a mammoth eater and the medium pork burrito crammed with goodness had me full and happy.This place is the 'bomb diggity.'

photos.caption: Photo of Tortilla - Islington - London, United Kingdom

2flsVBQs24Jjmz83LDpzNA.text: Like Katherine said, in California (where I'm from) this place would be a 2/3 star at best.  Hooowever, in London, the land of good indian and pub food, Tortilla is like Johnny Knoxville in The Ringer.Huge burritos, not very expensive.  They have guac (which isn't even terrible!).  They have multitudes of hot sauce for you to drown your miseries in.  Seriously, I watched a guy chug half a bottle of hot sauce yesterday.  I am sure the rest of his night (or at least the next morning) wasn't the most pleasant .Overall, I will eat here again. Probably many more times.  But the entire time I will be pining for real Mexican food.

I-obdjNMDe2sr6NG105ToA.text: Decent for a burrito joint in London.  Kind of like a Chipotle, but not as good.The steak was tasty and the rest of the fillers were good.  The tortilla was a little on the dry side but I guess some people may like that.  I like mine on the softer side.  I thought it was weird how the twist the ends to wrap the burrito in foil.  The ends of the tortilla get caught in the foil and it makes it hard to eat the burrito when you're un-peeling it.

GkwD7MgIBE5tFfH5V6cLKw.text: Faux Chipotle, American-style burrito-based Mexican. Not bad. Nothing amazing, and waaay too much red onion in their pico, but a decent little taco spot.

Tm2Q0GmACIE3SMoM_XRZlA.text: Like some reviewers before me, I am from California...SoCal, to be exact; ie: North Northern Mexico. I *know* me some Mexican food.  Is this good? Well, it's London good. In California, this place is just above a Taco Bell, but well below the hole-in-the-wall place where  the meat is questionable and chopped up by a one-armed man named Flaco (who is anything but).Does that mean I won't go back? Hay-ul no!!  I've been 6 times in 5 weeks!! It's not great, but it's better than nothing!! The chips are abysmal, the carnitas need more flavor, and the guacamole is passable, at best. But the chicken is really good, and with enough of the hot sauce that they leave on the table (not the Valentino, the...Cholua? Can't recall the name), it makes up for the lack of...something that's missing. I'm not sure what that something is; perhaps lard? Perhaps Abuelita Concepcion doing a Hail Mary over the frijoles? Dunno.tortilla, if you're reading this: BEAN AND CHEESE BURRITO, STAT!!!!!  Trust me. You want street cred, you have to offer the humble bean and cheese burrito.

Zyht4lGJkHf-t4Mgg1pC9g.text: It's good if you like bland beans chucked together with bland rice, bland cheese, bland fajita vegetables and some lettuce, completely slathered with chipotle sauce that looks like Branston pickle but doesn't taste that nice.Otherwise, it's not so good.The guacamole is fine and the beer selection is pretty good, that is, if you can look past the fact that half of it was American rather than Mexican.But if you're not exclusively in the mood for guacamole and beer from the Americas, then Tortilla probably isn't your best option.Head up Upper Street and go to Chilango. At least they have Cholula.

lgjSHsOI6WWzQW2P7Wd-Ng.text: Burrito Quest- Tortilla takes the #1 spotFinally some good burritos in London!! Love the pork, super juicy and the guac is so good and served in a large container for maximum chip dippage.  Also, on it's own, I would give this place a 3 but the sauce that mimics Taco Bell Hot Sauce (without the packages with the funny sayings) that they have here at Tortilla bumps this place up to 4 stars.  Endless fountain diet coke and the opportunity to order a small or large burrito (perfect for those normal days or extra hungover days) makes this my top burrito spot in London!

z5TPNn_LXSDCdHI3THBbUA.text: We managed to win the quiz at the Tortilla Qype Event at the Leadenhall Market branch  which meant some great prizes including some complimentary burrito vouchers. THANK YOU!!!!! Time to get sampling.. This is our closest branch so decided to grab a quick lunch whilst on a flying shopping trip. The actual location is fine  almost opposite Angel tube  the building itself not as cute as Leadenhall Market but bright and clean. Had a pulled pork medium burrito with hot sauce  quality just as good as our last visit so they have the production consistency right. I like Tortilla  fresh, with lots of options and great value.

photos.caption: Photo of Tortilla - Islington - London, United Kingdom

hwALOuzetQiCUlb1-JCLWg.text: When I lived on the other side of the Atlantic, no-frills burritos were a mainstay of my diet - cheap, quick, tasty and not wholly unhealthy. So I certainly welcome the recent taqueria invasion of London. Tortilla forms part of the vanguard.The inevitable comparison to its US/Mexican brethren is never going to be favourable - the quality is not quite up to snuff and the price is somewhat inflated. But it's also irrelevant - I've not given up noodles because no Pad Thai in London can live up to Bangkok. The bottom line: I go back quite regularly.

QoePuN5N2B2uPK_h9uAuIA.text: My friend introduced me to this place after I kept whining about missing Mexican food after my years spent living in California. I have tried Mexican food in ample places in London and all over Europe for that matter and most of then simply don't taste good, in fact they taste bad.. just like the lack of decent Thai food in London!BUT when I walked into Tortilla and saw the pictures of amazing Mexican places in San Francisco such as Pancho Villa I not only wanted to cry, cuz I lived just around the block from there, but I also had hope! And in fact the burritos are quite good (for London standards, but I will never get a California burrito here) and they even serve micro-brewed San Francisco beer Blue Moon! Also, I am a pescetarian and their veggie burritos and guacamole are yummy! I love re-friend beans and Tortilla's don't come with beacon as the re-fried beans from Chipotle. I only wish that it would have fish tacos, but none of the places I have tried in London have them, so I guess its just a bit too much to ask!I am taking two points off because I think the prices could be a bit lower and to go to the bathrooms, you have to walk through the kitchen which I think is a bit weird, but I guess better than no bathroom! And it is pretty good Mexican food but FOR London. In San Francisco I would not go to this place twice.

jccRg02nIOT_jB4MIbbpow.text: In California, this would definitely be a 3 or more likely 2 star joint. I, like Jennifer H. used to live in San Franciso and frequented the iconic staples of Taqueria history like Taqueria Cancun and Pancho Villa.Ok, no way is Tortilla like those. However, some of the worst meals vie paid for thus far in London have been Mexican, and this was not one fo them. In London, when the burrito craving hits, this will do the trick. And I didn't try the guacamole, but it was the most authentic, best looking guacamole I've seen thus far in London. It was chunky and vibrant green, so they didn't water it down with soured cream like I've frequently seen here in the UK. I will def try that next time.The chicken meat is nice and salty and flavorful, not Cancun, but will do.

Is9WgRHU-uHgt-N9qsRQvw.text: Love this place. It's a simple menu as most restaurants like this are. my favorite is the large burrito which with the price increase is now £6. Still this is still good value. The staff allow u to have a half and half which is awesome as I like the pork and chiken just the same as each other. The restaurant it's self is clean and modern with a nice south American feel. Ohhh and the portion sizing is awesome if u catch my drift...!

qywAAsQhmRzcYr1MSuAv5Q.text: Apparently all these burrito places in London are the same, not 'good' but not bad. Tortilla/Chilango/Chipotle.. whatever, right?Well let me be the voice of dissent. Because this was not as good as its neighbour Chilango. Admittedly I am a vegetarian so stop reading now if you are looking for a 'dirty' meat burrito. Their burritos are smaller than Chilango for the same price and the veg option was mostly just grilled onion. I hate onion but will tolerate it in a burrito because it is usually surrounded by goodness. There was no guac and cheesey goodness, only oniony badness. I kept waiting to hit that area of tasty burrito heaven hidden inside and it never arrived. Not a fan. I'll stick to Chilango, thanks. I do prefer the seating and decor though, feels less like a fast food joint and somewhere you can chill.

mmSnomhXtxcQM53xfeigfQ.text: Did you take the SATs? If so, here's a little flashback to your junior year in high school:Chilango is to Chipolte as Qdoba is to ___________ ?Yup -- here we go again with another US burrito joint knock off -- and wouldn't you know, they offer a nearly identical menu to Qdoba: from the pulled pork soft tacos to the naked burrito. But you know what? It's a-ok by me. Sometimes you just want to unwrap the tinfoil on a big juicy burrito and shove the mediocrity in your face. I must say -- the guacamole was particularly tasty!

FwtwJbZhO62BxtShHSFDMA.text: since going on the Qype event where we went to another branch of Tortilla.I have been obsessed with burritos lol.A really tasty meal in a flour tortilla - i always go for the braised pork and a bean mix topped with cheese and sour cream with the mexican rice.These are very weighty so make sure your not on a night out as you wont be able to move afterwards

PkvdtoFhKlXXoPaJ7Fdk-A.text: Exact same thing as Chipotle in the US basically. But a worthy impersonation and a good burrito for a girl from California who knows good Mexican food. You order a burrito/taco whatever and then add toppings. All in all, when I had been craving a burrito, it quenched my burrito thirst. And i have been there twice now and would go back again.

synk395p7UIx7yd_1Ek-lQ.text: If you understand this question:  "Are you a or Chipotle or a Qdoba?"  then you'll understand this question: "Are you a Tortilla or Chilango?"  I'm a Tortilla.  (and a Qdoba)Tortilla is my fix of American-style burritos, they're cheap & cheerful and they provide bottles of Cholula for you to drench your lunch with to your heart's desire.  If you go in for lunchtime, you can get a medium burrito and a soda for 5 pounds!  If I'm around Angel and I can't make up my mind on what to eat, I'll usually end up here.

hkI0lFn4XEgo9dOtclOQCw.text: Pretty good burrito for the price. Chicken, beans and rice were all pretty good, so was the sour cream and cheese. Salsa lacked a bit of kick though, and burrito had a little too much sauce. Very friendly staff, they had to deal with a nasty customer after me and came to check if we were enjoying our meal. Overall, quite a nice place but nothing to go out of your way for.

KVFRDNoZWTtanlaUL6vx0g.text: The food can be good, but the prep is very inconsistent. Sometimes you get something with half as much meat as other times. I've had a quesadilla with barely any chicken in it, and other times it's made well.

9N_ruHGZTBuaIweVHGtsgA.text: I understand why this place has 3.5 stars now. I came here a couple days ago to get a much needed post-workout burrito. The staff was lovely and super efficient, however, the main deal, the burrito was just ok.I got the pulled pork which I normally love (I noted they were not very generous with how much they gave me) perhaps it's because I said I wanted medium not large?I added cheese and guac and it was all on a bed of Mexican rice, pinto beans and some salsa.The issue was that with all those ingredients, the burrito was just bland... I devoured it because I was starving but at no point did I think mmmm. Very sad.The price £6 pounds for a filling burrito with fresh guacamole I thought was good, but without the flavours i can't see myself going back... will try chilango down the road next time.

1_Qw3gGb7th4NzQYKfhL9g.text: Multiple pieces of plastic found in Deliveroo pork bowl. Disgusting and disappointing. Order elsewhere.

S-XeXqIEs_sBYmxNxVGELw.text: Popped in with a friend for a burrito before a gig at o2 academy Islington!  Very small location but quick and easy and clean, also very cheap and cheerful.The staff were very friendly & smiley straight away which was nice!I had a medium sized vegetable burrito with both kinds of rice - tomato and coriander & lime (I think) + both kinds of beans - refried and kidney (I think) with cooked peppers. Due to it being the veggie option I got a free dollop of guacamole, and left out the sour cream and cheese (cry) because they're not vegan friendly... I dream of the day burrito places have vegan friendly cheese!I also opted for some chilli and lime cashews which were completely amazing and I now need to get in bulk. I highly recommend trying them!!Unfortunately during our visit the frozen margarita machine was broken which was very disappointing, but other than that it was an enjoyable visit and would go again if I needed something nice and easy!

photos.caption: Photo of Tortilla - Islington - London, United Kingdom. Medium burrito and delicious cashews!

wg66T8vPnZs2JeXkyAP2hQ.text: Huge burrito for a little price. Really filling but not too heavy. I don't really like this location because it's way too small and dingy but if you want a quick bite then this is a good joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Tortilla - Islington - London, United Kingdom. Chicken burrito with guacamole ftw!

GbkYKi1q9gejXSHhQ0ot5w.text: I really dig Tortilla but I have to admit, this location is not my favorite. It's a bit small and has low ceilings but since I generally take my meal to go, I'm not affected much by the space.For £5, a medium naked burrito or burrito is a real bargain. The portion size is larger than what I would expect for £5. It tastes great, fills me up and makes me happy.Now I'm just waiting for their new "after 3pm" menu to arrive which includes quesadillas and nachos. The quesadillas (consumed at their Richmond store a few weeks ago) are incredibly delicious. I. Can't. Wait.

PbuvtsowwcwxeOX8Ai7dfQ.text: Tortilla does good burritos...I have to say. And lemme tell you, I'm a spoilt brat, having lived in San Francisco, a burrito-mecca, for quite a while!I've had my first Tortilla-burrito at Yelp event a while back and chatting with the owner, I found out that he's actually from San Francisco - which probably explains why I like their burritos. And since the event, I've kind of made Tortilla my default-Mexican food stop when my craving gets too strong.My tip: when you get a steak or pork burrito - ask them to NOT squeeze out the juice. I find that a juicy (well-lubricated) burrito is much tastier. Also, do invest in extra-guacamole, as this will uplift the flavour tremendously. (They are a little stingy on the guacamole though.)

photos.caption: Photo of Tortilla - Islington - London, United Kingdom. It was this yummy...

ccnQkAs4-hW30ZpMU77DfQ.text: They said they are like a real California burrito, and on my quest to find a California style burrito around the world when I'm longing for home (California), I finally found one!They aren't kidding! It DID taste like a real CA burrito! Very tasty indeed!Bravo Tortilla! Bravo!

VB72vuaVwADz7Cdny3ClAA.text: Being a native Californian and Mexican, I've come to terms with expecting disappointment when it comes to Mexican food in London. Seriously...each time I've tried, my tummy cries baby unicorn tears.Despite it's super cheesy name, Tortilla gives Chipotle a run for their money! The owners are from Cali and have infused their eco-social awareness into their food. And at £5-£6, the burritos are reasonably priced. They serve margaritas and various Mexican beers like Tecate and Corona.If the Tortilla gods are reading this, you guys need to make Cali burritos. You can only get them in San Diego but they have carne asada fries in them and they pretty much best thing in life ever invented. Thank you.You can't compare Tortilla's burritos to authentic greasy-spoon-taqueria burritos...you have to go to Cali for that. But it's as close as you can get in the land of tea and crumpets!

photos.caption: Photo of Tortilla - Islington - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tortilla - Islington - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tortilla - Islington - London, United Kingdom

UR15zV5tfjfPTt8QT_AbtQ.text: Terrible burritos from Tortilla strikes again!Let me clarify firstly that there is nothing CALIFORNIA about this chain other than the name in the title.I've met these owners, i know they're from Northern California, and myself coming from Santa Barbara, I get that they want to be 'authentic'. Charming. Its totally been watered down to meet the british palates. Don't get me wrong, there's tons of great and flavourful food that Britain makes, but lets be real, Mexican food is not one of them. And Tortilla has stepped off of its California flavour profile to deliver less than flavourful food in a health conscience backdrop. Kudos for being healthy, but honestly if I wanted raw peppers in my burrito i would get a salad instead. There was little meat in my burrito and though the paler beans were ok, they weren't stellar. There was so much rice and so little meat it was really astounding as to the ratio, maybe that was first night opening faux pas, and the peppers & onions were close to being raw. which wasn't nice. It would've been nicer had they been sauteed.The large size was good. Now thats the part where california could put a stamp of approval on. Overall: You continue to disappoint me. #sorrynotsorry

WGFPehTYnZWcPm5AMw87fA.text: Excellent! I am from SoCal and absolutely Love Mexican food. I was so happy my friend introduced me to this place. The food is filling, very delicious, and at a great price! Has the traditional Mexican flavor I have been seeking since moving to London. I will definitely be making my rounds here.

Ux1FoFSFMU9lBxqGiw7LbQ.text: Tomato rice and barbacoa beef. Shit yes. Also, go for the medium burrito, I can't imagine how large the "large" is. Another plus, white labeled chalula. Hells yeah.

photos.caption: Photo of Tortilla - Islington - London, United Kingdom. Barbacoa beef... Shit yes

wm0VAUAMD8BsUnTxYqZ3Hg.text: Pretty mediocre, but the prices are fair and they really cram all the "stuff" in there.While assembling, she really piled on the meat - I had the barbecoa beef - which when rolled up, became a thick core of juicy cow straight down the center. Some bites were full-on pulled beef and nothing else. I want to say this was too much, and I even had some of almost everything else (rice, grilled veggies, beans, salsa, sour cream, jalapenos, squeeze of lime) but they got drowned in the salty abundance of beef. At the same time, when it comes to the meat, most places will err on the side of stingy, so its hard to really gripe about it.I tend to think that when you're eating a burrito a large part of experience is the simple glory of eating something so solid and filling. So on that point, they win.

LAbvPrmhY0O-uIYJgWiyZw.text: So just before a trip to the theatre, me and a friend popped in here for a quick dinner. Great place to go if you only have 15 mins to eat, since friendly and quick service is a given. And burrito is super filling, so no rumbling stomachs throughout the performance. Win!We grabbed a couple of spots to sit in, not easy since there isn't much seating here. Burritos all round, I went for large since I was starving and basically inhaled it, but a good portion size and well bulked out with rice and beans. You get a pretty good choice here and at 6 quid for a large burrito I think it good value for money.Only 3 stars since it don't taste of very much to be honest. They ask you about a variety of options to add - salsa, sour cream, different rices, different sauces. But I couldn't taste the tomato in my rice, the medium spice in my sauce or the cheese. It was mainly salty pulled pork (which did fill a hole) and the black beans. All in all, I've had a better burrito, but for convenience and price you can't really complain :)

twJcCILs9926WnAb4au3Mg.text: Having spent the last few years bouncing back and forth between Los Angeles, Mexican Mecca, and Colorado, birthplace of Chipotle Mexican Grill, I've grown pretty critical of San Francisco-style burrito joints. However, this judgement has been curtailed in London primarily due to the fact that the city is almost completely devoid of the giant, affordable burritos that are commonplace back in the states. This being the case, I was excited to give Tortilla a shot. Location-wise Tortilla is great. The area surrounding Angel Tube Stop is full of both shopping and dining gems, and the establishment is mere meters from the tube entrance/exit. From there, it's pretty much impossible to write up a review of Tortilla without constant comparisons to Chipotle Mexican Grill, so I won't even try.The food is good and authentic in terms of what a San Francisco-style burrito looks like in the states, but the size of the burritos and the quality and taste of the ingredients really do fall short of what Chipotle can offer.  Granted, for 5 GBP, it's hard to complain, but if you're looking for good American-style Burrito, just stick with Chipotle Mexican Grill.

gCmGIyYYH4LXPuBFadOsyg.text: Was based in Angel for a few days and came across this place and ended up coming here a few times. Being from SF/Oakland, I thought it was one of the better burritos I've had in London. Would definitely return next time I'm in London.

XbqAYav9czMFz3dwJ6NDgA.text: Probably my favourite burrito place in Angel, the portions and prices are decent and the flavours are great. I love cholula sauce and the extra large bottles of it allows me to go crazy with my application of the beautiful sauce. I like that they do a loyalty card also, always nice to get some free food at some point!

Zq_rx5ZLTEOtK-XBqttsog.text: surprisingly, i liked it here... A LOT - and a few days after eating here, i found myself craving what i'd eaten again!! i know this isn't *real* mexican, but the meat was tender and juicy, the tortillas were nice and seemed fresh, and i liked the guacamole as well. plus this place is close enough to my flat to become my regular place!! i tried chilango after coming here, and i think this place is seriously better.. the pork tacos were niiiicee, and i'm craving them again now which MEANS SOMETHING you know?  one awkward thing - when they were putting the guacamole on my tacos, they tried to charge me the extra pound twice, like per each taco because he put a lot on.. and i had to be like um no. take some off then, i'm not paying two pounds.. whatez all good in the end though!!

VQ4PFOhk6jyVad80HKTZ5w.text: The burrito itself is decent. No, I don't think it's quite as good as the Chilango competition up the road, but it's still very tasty and dare I say it, better value for money (in terms of size).I prefer this location to Chilango though. It's a little more chill, the seating is better and it's convenient for the tube.
